Name: Montego Bay
Ingredients: 7.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Review: The name suggests Jamaica, but the recipe stipulates Martinique agricole rum.
History: Adapted from a recipe in Victor Bergeron 's 1972 Trader Vic's Bartender's Guide where it is accompanied by Trader Vic's "TV" logo, indicating it is a signature cocktail.
Nutrition: One serving of Montego Bay contains 156 calories
